conclusion: Determine the charge that passes through R1 when the switch S is opened.
Determine the initial charges on the capacitors when the switch S is closed.
Calculate the equivalent capacitance and the voltage across each capacitor when the switch S is closed.
Determine the charges on the capacitors when the switch S is opened.
Find the difference in charge on C1 before and after the switch is opened.
Calculate total resistance: R_total = R1 + R2 = 10.0 Ω.
Calculate voltage across R1: V_R1 = 4 V.
Calculate voltage across R2: V_R2 = 6 V.
Voltage across C1 is equal to voltage across R1.
Voltage across C2 is equal to voltage across R2.
Calculate charge on C1: Q_C1 = 120 μC.
Calculate charge on C2: Q_C2 = 180 μC.
Total charge on capacitors: Q_total = 300 μC.
Calculate voltage across equivalent capacitance: V_eq = 20 V.
Calculate charge on C1 after switch is opened: Q_C1' = 600 μC.
Calculate charge passing through R1: Q_pass = 480 μC.
Final answer: 480 μC passes through R1.
